dublin_core.dcvalue: This study investigates the effect of passenger and phone conversations on sleep restricted driving Six volunteers 50 male mean age 24 8 4 3 years had their sleep restricted to 4 h in bed followed by a 20 min simulated drive on three separate occasions Each drive included either a passenger conversation a mobile phone conversation or a quiet passenger The effect size of a phone conversation on lane deviation was large while passenger conversation was small The main effect of conversation on lane deviation was non significant F 2 10 2 57 p 0 126 Combining sleep restricted driving with conversations warrants further investigation
Driving when distracted and sleepy: The effect of phone and passenger conversations on driving performance.
